@graph.name: Nagi
@graph.description: I believe you can make great food with everyday ingredients even if youâ€™re short on time and cost conscious. You just need to cook clever and get creative!

@graph.name: Madeleines
@graph.description: Recipe video above. Madeleines are sweet little French sponge cakes that are as delightful to look at as they are to eat. Flavoured with a hint of lemon and with the signature shell shape, these adorable mini butter cakes make for a lovely afternoon tea, or a pretty finish for any meal. Best served hot and fresh out of the oven. Keep the batter in a piping bag, then 10 minutes in the oven is all it takes!
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup + 1 tbsp  plain flour (all purpose flour)
2/3 cup caster sugar (superfine sugar) ((ordinary / granulated sugar ok too))
1 tbsp vegetable oil ((or other neutral oil))
3 tbsp milk (, full fat (low fat ok too))
135g / 9.5 tbsp  unsalted butter (, melted, warm (not hot))
Canola oil spray ((or other neutral oil))
Icing sugar / powdered sugar ((optional, for dusting))

recipeInstructions.text: Sift flour: Sift the flour and baking powder into a bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Sift flour: Sift the flour and baking powder into a bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk eggs and sugar: Whisk the eggs and sugar vigorously for 2 minutes until it becomes paler in colour and it's foamy (or 1 minute on speed 6 with handheld beater).
recipeInstructions.name: Whisk eggs and sugar: Whisk the eggs and sugar vigorously for 2 minutes until it becomes paler in colour and it's foamy (or 1 minute on speed 6 with handheld beater).

recipeInstructions.text: Mix flour in 3 parts: Add the flour mixture in 3 parts, whisking gently in between until combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix flour in 3 parts: Add the flour mixture in 3 parts, whisking gently in between until combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Add everything else except butter: Add salt, oil, milk, honey, vanilla and lemon. Mix until combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Add everything else except butter: Add salt, oil, milk, honey, vanilla and lemon. Mix until combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Add butter: Add butter, mix gently with a rubber spatula until combined. The batter is fairly thin but should leave a faint ribbon briefly on the surface (see video).
recipeInstructions.name: Add butter: Add butter, mix gently with a rubber spatula until combined. The batter is fairly thin but should leave a faint ribbon briefly on the surface (see video).

recipeInstructions.text: Cover and refrigerate: Cover with plastic wrap touching the surface and leave it in the fridge overnight (minimum 6 hours).
recipeInstructions.name: Cover and refrigerate: Cover with plastic wrap touching the surface and leave it in the fridge overnight (minimum 6 hours).

itemListElement.text: Preheat oven to 200Â°C / 390Â°F (180Â°C fan) for at least 30 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Preheat oven to 200Â°C / 390Â°F (180Â°C fan) for at least 30 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Piping bags - Pour the madeleine batter into 2 piping bags (or 1 large) either fitted with a round tip nozzle around 0.7 - 1.2cm (0.3 - 0.5") wide, or snip the end off. (You can refrigerate until required at this stage, or freeze 2 months).
itemListElement.name: Piping bags - Pour the madeleine batter into 2 piping bags (or 1 large) either fitted with a round tip nozzle around 0.7 - 1.2cm (0.3 - 0.5") wide, or snip the end off. (You can refrigerate until required at this stage, or freeze 2 months).

itemListElement.text: Spray and fill pan: Spray the madeleine pan with oil. Fill each hole almost to the top (2just 1m from the rim).
itemListElement.name: Spray and fill pan: Spray the madeleine pan with oil. Fill each hole almost to the top (2just 1m from the rim).

itemListElement.text: Bake: Bake for 10 minutes until light golden.
itemListElement.name: Bake: Bake for 10 minutes until light golden.

itemListElement.text: Serve warm! Unmold straight away. Pile onto serving platter. Dust with icing sugar and serve immediately, while hot!
itemListElement.name: Serve warm! Unmold straight away. Pile onto serving platter. Dust with icing sugar and serve immediately, while hot!

@graph.keywords: afternoon tea, french baking, french cake, madeleines
